Introduction Erik Wilde (@dret): Accelerate Sampler

(3) About Me

  • Ph.D. in Communications Systems [http://dret.net/netdret/publications#wil97b] from ETH Zürich [http://www.ethz.ch/] (1997)
  • Research at ETH Zürich [http://www.ethz.ch/] (1997-2006) and UC Berkeley [http://www.berkeley.edu/] (2006-2011)
  • EMC (2011-2014), API architecture for Documentum workflow products
  • Siemens (2014-2015), working on the Web of Things (APIs for IoT)
  • Part of CA [http://www.ca.com/]'s API Academy [http://www.apiacademy.co/] 2016-2019 focusing on API Design and Management
  • Partner at Good API [https://www.goodapi.co/] in 2019 focusing on Digital Transformation and API Strategy
  • Joined Axway [https://www.axway.com/]'s Catalysts [https://www.axway.com/services/catalysts] in 2019 for driving the Accelerate program [https://accelerate.axway.com/]
  • Active in the usual places such as Twitter [http://twitter.com/dret], GitHub [http://github.com/dret], and LinkedIn [http://www.linkedin.com/in/netdret]

(7) Digital Transformation is a Challenge



Digital Transformation and APIs Erik Wilde (@dret): Accelerate Sampler

(8) Digital Transformation Definition

Digital Transformation means adapting an organization's strategy and structure to capture opportunities enabled by digital technology. (Nathan Furr and Andrew Shipilov, Digital Doesn't Have to Be Disruptive, Harvard Business Review 97(4), July/August 2019, pp. 94-103) [https://hbr.org/2019/07/digital-doesnt-have-to-be-disruptive]



Digital Transformation and APIs Erik Wilde (@dret): Accelerate Sampler

(9) Digital Transformation: Business & Technology Align



Digital Transformation and APIs Erik Wilde (@dret): Accelerate Sampler

(10) APIs Fix Anything!



Digital Transformation and APIs Erik Wilde (@dret): Accelerate Sampler

(11) APIs Are Just Plumbing



Digital Transformation and APIs Erik Wilde (@dret): Accelerate Sampler

(12) Digital Transformation is Continuous

  • Digital transformation happens at two different levels
    • Transforming the organization to become better at adapting to changes
    • Identifying and implementing capabilities that improve the organization
  • You're never done with digital transformation
    • Business must be empowered and capable to identify opportunities
    • Organization must be capable of acting fast to capture opportunities
    • Technology must be able to realize opportunities quickly and safely


Accelerate

Outline (Accelerate)

  1. Introduction [3]
  2. Digital Transformation and APIs [6]
  3. Accelerate [4]
  4. API Strategy [3]
  5. Conclusions [2]
Accelerate Erik Wilde (@dret): Accelerate Sampler

(14) Outcomes over Output

  • High failure rate of digital transformation initiatives
  • Technology is necessary but not sufficient
    • It is important to do things right
    • It is even more important to do the right things
  • Help customers to make good decisions on three levels
    • How to design, build, and manage individual API products
    • How to cultivate and evolve the API landscape
    • How to align overall strategy towards API success


Accelerate Erik Wilde (@dret): Accelerate Sampler

(15) Accelerate Workshops

  • Various workshops [https://accelerate.axway.com/] in a fixed 1-2 day format
    • Strategy: Working on and defining your API strategy
    • Design & Lifecycle: API product management and the API lifecycle
    • API Program: Evaluating and improving your API program


Accelerate Erik Wilde (@dret): Accelerate Sampler

(16) Accelerate Journey

  • A 90-day engagement for getting customers started
  • Individual journeys assembled from a number of ingredients
    • Compasses help with assessments and establishing starting points
    • Modules are used to work on topics that are jointly identified
    • Axway specialists help with putting the initiative into practice


Accelerate Erik Wilde (@dret): Accelerate Sampler

(17) Accelerate Journey Modules

Strategy Landscape Product
  • Introduction to APIs
  • Digital Transformation
  • Monetization
  • Programs
  • Governance
  • Strategy
  • Platforms
  • Internal vs. External APIs
  • Anti-Patterns
  • Culture
  • Prioritizing
  • Organizational Aspects
  • Partners, Platforms, and Ecosystems
  • Caching
  • Description
  • Design
  • Hypermedia
  • Protocols
  • Representations
  • REST
  • Standards
  • Styles
  • Design Thinking
  • Lifecycle Management
  • Landscape Management
  • Guidelines
  • Change Management
  • Documentation and DX
  • Testing
  • Microservices
  • Monitoring
  • Security
  • Consumption
  • Cloud and Hybrid
  • Identity Management

(19) CAM Strategy Compass Pillars



API Strategy Erik Wilde (@dret): Accelerate Sampler

(20) CAM Strategy Compass Perspectives



API Strategy Erik Wilde (@dret): Accelerate Sampler

(21) API Strategy = Pillars × Perspectives

External Internal
Biz
  • API monetization
  • Revenue-supporting APIs
  • Increase speed & feedback
  • Identify & stabilize enablers
  • Design for externalization
  • Increase biz insight with dashboards
Org
  • Focus on documentation/DX
  • Support discovery/self-service
  • Collect DX feedback
  • Products > projects (ownership)
  • Team enablement/support
  • Loose coupling for speed/agility
Tech
  • Tech trends and popularity
  • Invest in on-boarding support
  • Secure through platform
  • Loosely coupled implementations
  • Observe patterns and practices
  • Establish C4E for platform/support


Conclusions

Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): Accelerate Sampler

(23) The Value of API Initiatives

  • Figure out why you are using APIs
  • Define what you want to achieve on your API journey
  • Work on how these goals can be accomplishes
  • Verify your goals and achievements along the way


Conclusions Erik Wilde (@dret): Accelerate Sampler
